Context: What is Agile 24x7
Text_Response: It is a project management tool which helps your team collaboration

Context: What is Agile Project Management
Text_Response: Agile project management is an iterative process to your projects and ensures feedback can be acted on quickly and that responsive changes can be made at each stage of a sprint or product cycle

Context: What is a Sprint Cycle
Text_Response: It is the time frame defined by your team in order to Finish a certain amount of User stories.

Context: How are you different from other Project Management Tools.
Text_Response: We have an all in one tool that allows project teams to work quickly and collaboratively within the timeframe on one platform.

Context: what are the different access
Text_Response: Admin and User

Context: Roles In Agile 24x7
Text_Response: Product Owner, Scrum Master, Contributer

Context: Product Owner
Text_Response: The person responsible for maximizing the value of the work completed by the Development Team.

Context: Scrum Master
Text_Response: Works to facilitate and support the Scrum process across the Product Owner, the Development Team, and importantly, the organization at large.

Context: Contributer
Text_Response: A small group of people who are ultimately working on The Product Development

Context: Backlog
Text_Response: Everything that the team needs to do (for example, everything that’s needed in a product) is listed out in a Backlog and ranked in order of priority by the Product Owner or the Scrum Master

Context: What is Sprint
Text_Response: Each sprint has a predefined Sprint Goal. Items from the Backlog are identified and worked on as part of each Sprint.

Context: Sprint Planning
Text_Response: Before a Sprint can happen, you need to do some Sprint Planning to figure out what your Sprint Goal will be and how you’re going to accomplish it.

Context: What is a Scrum Call
Text_Response: Once the Sprint is underway, the Development Team has a short daily standup — called a Daily Scrum — to report on the previous day’s progress, what they’ll be focusing on today, and any risks they’ve identified.

Context: End of Sprint Cycle
Text_Response: At the end of each Sprint, the team holds a Sprint Review (sort of like a Sprint-specific post-mortem meeting) to assess their performance and inform the next round of Sprint Planning.

Context: Which agile methodology is right for me?
Text_Response: Agile24x7 If you’re still trying to decide which methodology you should go with — agile vs Scrum vs Kanban vs Scrumban vs some other hybrid?
